I fought to get increased, direct, and rapid support for New Jersey and our community into the CARES Act. These grants will help our local governments in their ongoing response efforts, and I will continue to work with our local elected officials to respond to their needs.

Our counties and towns are working around the clock to provide support for our residents as we face the unprecedented challenges of #COVID19. Today, I announced more than $7.9 million in COVID Recovery Grants for #NJ11 from the CARES Act: https://t.co/3ivZz68Qyi

I will continue to work with stakeholders at all levels of government to help our state and our country. 7/

My military training taught me that an Army marches on its stomach ‚Äî that our supply lines are essential to success in the field. We must have a national plan for PPE, and coordinated purchasing, production, and procurement that comes from the federal government. 6/
More federal government support would also help local manufacturers mitigate risk as they look to re-tool their factories to help increase PPE and ventilator production here at home. 5/

I advocated again for a rigorous implementation of the #DefenseProductionAct. Increased supply chain support from the federal government will help us make sure areas that are at the epicenter of this crisis get the equipment and gear they need. 4/

I had some good news from the Director: He told me they are focused on how to turn key medical equipment over to the states as quickly as possible. This is vital for New Jersey ‚Äî we have the second highest number of COVID-19 cases in the country. 3/

I talked about the importance of getting additional personal protective equipment (PPE) and ventilators to NJ. I told him about my calls every morning with our local healthcare providers, and their concerns about protecting personnel and expanding intensive care capacity. 2/

Spoke yesterday with the Acting Director of the Strategic National Stockpile to advocate for New Jersey and the critical need for key medical equipment for our healthcare systems, nursing homes, and first responders on the front lines in our state. 1/

We are immensely proud of New Jersey's healthcare providers and first responders. We have also been overwhelmed by the resilience of NJ companies, many of whom have offered to re-tool production lines to begin to manufacture PPE. They need support from the federal government.

PPE supplies are essential to keeping our healthcare workers safe. I urged the President to move forward with utilizing the Defense Production Act. We need our great American companies to expand production of critical medical supplies. https://t.co/5ukniX9TDk

I will continue to work with my colleagues to make sure that we are producing enough of the vital equipment necessary to keep healthcare professionals safe while we attempt to flatten the curve, and to pass additional legislation to support our workers, businesses, and economy.

We must make sure our medical providers have the equipment necessary to administer #COVID19 tests. We need to protect small businesses and employees so they can make it through this tough time. We need personal protective equipment, respirators, ventilators & more hospital beds.

This bipartisan bill is a tremendous step in the right direction ‚Äì it provides paid sick leave and paid family leave, strengthens unemployment benefits, makes #COVID19 testing free for all, and provides food and medical aid to those in need.
 
But so much more needs to be done. https://t.co/7DhujFDk5m
